string.text: %c[ui_gray_2]Loners, also known as free stalkers, are generally unaligned with the various groups operating in the Zone. While factions are organized in hierarchies and commonly have designated leaders and goals, free stalkers only work for themselves and work with whoever suits them. The majority of people roaming the Zone belong to this informal group.

%c[ui_gray_2]Bandits are an informal faction of outlaws in the Zone, without affiliation to other groups. Its members regard the lands of the Zone as a lawless place to be exploited for personal gain and fulfillment, a place to live out violent delights and take advantage of the unfortunate people crossing their path. Many of its members led a life of crime even before coming to the Zone, now using its insulated state as a way to hide from the law of the outside world.

%c[ui_gray_2]Duty is a paramilitary group and a major faction operating in the Zone. Duty's public motive is to protect the outside world from the dangers of the Zone, shield both the world from it and whatever it holds from the world, ultimately working towards its eradication. While Ukrainian military detachments primarily guard the Zone's borders, Duty takes a much more active role inside the Zone, managing expeditions, assembling efforts to control mutant threats, and pushing back against other groups deemed hostile to their goals. They actively maintain a working relationship with the present military force. Some say they themselves are in part funded by governmental agencies.

%c[ui_gray_2]Freedom is a semi-organized anarchist group consisting mainly of free stalkers with the common goal of preserving the Zone in its present state and enabling a peaceful co-existence of all who are interested in its wonders. They directly oppose any faction trying to monopolize control over the Zone. Some say, Freedom's leaders have wisely accepted the fact the Zone can not be eradicated and instead be accepted as an extension of the natural world and as a unique opportunity for research and study that should be open to anyone.

%c[ui_gray_2]The Military are composed of Ukrainian troops and commissioned officers and serve as the primary force separating the Zone and the outside world. Their mandate is to prevent unauthorized entry and the transport of illicit goods and artifacts. They are well-equipped for their defense role and their hardline approach often leads to a shoot-on-sight policy. Most of their work focusses on guarding the perimeter, though infrequent operations deeper inside the Zone have taken place in the past. Rumours of corruption among their ranks are common, some believing the Zone's supply chains and infrastructure would not be possible if they were fully committed to their apparent mission.

%c[ui_gray_2]Ecologists are another group operating inside the Zone with an official governmental mandate. They consist of researchers, scientists and contracted field assistants who research artifacts and anomalous areas. Their goal is to harness the Zone's inert mysteries, control and utilize them, and potentially develop technological advancements. Ecologists commonly operate with decentralized groups with their own organizational structures. Of all factions, Ecologist members are generally the most neutral. They tend to keep out of faction conflicts and stick to themselves and their pursuit of knowledge and science.

%c[ui_gray_2]Mercenaries are a loose group of private military contractors (PMCs) working in the Zone for outside clients or benefactors. These operators tend to work independently or in smaller squads and may be hostile towards interference when on an active assignment. Unlike other factions, mercenaries don't share common goals, or live a communal life with other stalkers. It is rumoured that their members use undisclosed entries and exits to the Zone further north. Many mercenaries were formerly stalkers or stationed military personnel who now offer their services for a price to interested parties.

%c[ui_gray_2]The followers of the Monolith are a religious cult that has settled in the deepest reaches of the Zone. The group believes in the elusive power and commandments of the Wish Granter, a strange monolithic artifact rumoured to exist at the heart of the Zone. Not much is known about the origin of its members, though their fanatic and aggressive behavior suggests a sort of advanced brainwashing and after-effects of psy emission exposure. Monolith can notably pass through areas affected by the brain scorcher and are generally ignored by mutated wildlife, making a deeper paranatural bond with the Zone likely.

%c[ui_gray_2]Clear Sky are an independent fringe group dedicated to research the mysteries of the Zone. The origins of Clear Sky date back to before the founding of all other factions. A bulk of the group was devastated by the occurrence of the Second Emission and the successive expeditionary effort, leaving only a small number of remnants at the faction's base in the Great Swamps, hidden from the rest of the Zone. Its members maintain good relations with ecologists and military forces.

%c[ui_gray_2]Renegades are a ruthless splinter group of rogue stalkers with no leaders or hierarchical structure. Many Renegades are outcasts of other factions, former bandits or free stalkers who have betrayed their group or committed other kinds of transgressions. After the events following the Second Emission and territorial fights around the Great Swamps, Renegades are no longer commonly encountered in the Zone.

%c[ui_gray_2]Sin are a hostile cult of psychically affected stalkers who believe in the Zone as a divine place for the redemption of humankind with a goal to allow the Zone to grow and subsume the outside world. Members of Sin often display a number of bodily mutations and have suffered from extensive exposure to the Zone's effects. Due to their appearance and dark green hooded outfits, they are also known as "dark stalkers". A possible affiliation with the Monolith is unknown.

%c[ui_gray_2]The United Nations International Scientific Group is an organization of special forces unit carrying out missions in secret throughout the Zone. General consensus is that while the Military and Ecologists represent local European interests, UNISG may work under the command of other United Nations member states. Its members operate in small but highly capable teams and are hostile to all interference with a strong motivation to prevent leaks on any information about their activities.

%c[ui_gray_2]Zombified stalkers are mindless husks, victims of prolonged psy field exposure or lethal doses of radiation. They are hostile to all living beings and will attack on sight with whatever weaponry they have left. They tend to group up with other creatures of the same fate and sometimes congregate in underground spaces.

%c[ui_gray_2]The Progression difficulty has a big impact on the economy, which affects the player's progression during their journey in the Zone. Aspects affected by this range from sell/buy prices with traders, repair/upgrade prices with mechanics, rarity of loot, money and goodwill earned by completing tasks and more.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]• %c[ui_gray_2]You can control each one of these aspects in your playthrough at any time.
 
 See "Extra Options -> Progression difficulty".

%c[ui_gray_2]Gameplay difficulty affects aspects related to the player such as protection against damage sources, stamina loss and carry weight, in addition to extra aspects such as water and sleep deprivation.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]• %c[ui_gray_2]You can control each one of these aspects in your playthrough at any time.
 
 See "Extra Options -> Gameplay difficulty".

%c[ui_gray_2]Story mode, when active, allows the player to experience a unique set of story-driven and dynamic questlines.
 Story-driven questlines such as "Living Legend", "Mortal Sin" and "Operation Afterglow" are only available to Loner, Duty, Freedom, Ecologist, Mercenary and Clear Sky factions. Dynamic questlines, however, can be enjoyed by all the playable factions. Speak to your faction leader to begin them.

%c[ui_gray_2]Ironman mode is a feature that will remove your game saves upon death. You are free to make as many saves as you wish but dying will result in the removal of all saves made with this character.
%c[ui_gray_2]Hardcore AI Aim is a feature that maximizes AI aim predictability, making it more difficult for the player to dodge hits while moving.

%c[ui_gray_2]Survival mode is a feature that replaces all spawns with Zombies. These hordes will make their way to your location. Be prepared and see how long you can survive!\n \n %c[d_red]• %c[ui_gray_2]Not compatible with Warfare mode

%c[ui_gray_2]In Azazel mode, death is not the end.
 Like the demon Azazel, you will possess a new body when you die by taking over the form of another random stalker that is currently existing within the Zone. If you have companions, you will become one of them. This feature compliments Ironman and/or Survival mode very well.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]• %c[ui_gray_2]All maps will be unlocked in Azazel mode
 %c[d_red]• %c[ui_gray_2]Not compatible with Story mode

%c[ui_gray_2]This mode grants Stalker's A-Life system more freedom, creating a more dynamic Zone. Faction ownership of bases and territories is more prone to change. Medics, traders and mechanics are now also replaceable. You also have the ability to lead your faction and help them with taking over the surrounding areas, achieving dominance in the Zone.
